faq-1.title: React + Vite
faq-1.description: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces, and Vite is a fast build tool for modern web development that enhances the development experience with React.

faq-2.title: Tailwind
faq-2.description: Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS framework that provides a set of pre-designed classes to rapidly build custom user interfaces.

faq-3.title: Responsive Design
faq-3.description: Design approach ensuring web applications adapt and display properly on various devices and screen sizes.

faq-4.title: Dark & Light Theme
faq-4.description: Option for users to switch between dark and light color schemes in the application interface.

faq-5.title: Version Control
faq-5.description: Managing and tracking changes to code using tools like Git to collaborate with others and maintain code history.

faq-6.title: Automatic Launch of your application after changes
faq-6.description: Automatically deploying application updates to production servers after code changes.

faq-7.title: Cloud Based Backend (SAAS)
faq-7.description: Using cloud platforms like AppWrite or Google Firebase to host backend services for scalability and reliability.

faq-8.title: Latest Technologies, React and React Native
faq-8.description: React and React Native are popular frameworks for building web and mobile applications, respectively, known for their efficiency and performance.

faq-9.title: Image Optimization
faq-9.description: Process of reducing image file size without sacrificing quality to improve website loading speed.

faq-10.title: Localization
faq-10.description: Ability to support multiple languages in the application to cater to a diverse user base.

faq-11.title: Scrum Principle
faq-11.description: Agile methodology emphasizing iterative development, collaboration, and adaptability to deliver software efficiently.

faq-12.title: After Service Period for Maintenance
faq-12.description: Offering maintenance services post-development for a fee of 50 Euros per year.

faq-13.title: Scalable Foundation Project
faq-13.description: Building a solid foundation for the project to support future growth and scalability seamlessly.

faq-14.title: Single Page Application
faq-14.description: Web application that dynamically updates content without reloading the entire page for smoother user experience.

faq-15.title: Figma Designs
faq-15.description: Providing visual designs created in Figma to give an idea of the application's appearance and layout.

faq-16.title: User Education
faq-16.description: Providing tutorials or documentation to guide users on how to use the application effectively.

faq-17.title: Theme Change
faq-17.description: Allowing users to switch between different color themes, such as dark and light modes.

faq-18.title: Handle 404 Page
faq-18.description: Designing and implementing a custom 404 error page to guide users when they encounter broken links or pages.

faq-19.title: Progressive Web Application (PWA)
faq-19.description: Web application that utilizes modern web capabilities to provide a native app-like experience, including offline functionality and push notifications.

faq-20.title: Free Demo
faq-20.description: Offering a trial version or demonstration of the existing application without charge.

terms_and_conditions.t_c_1: Once Design is ready, the client should not change the requirement.
terms_and_conditions.t_c_2: 50% cash payment is due at the start of the project, with the remaining 50% due upon project completion.
terms_and_conditions.t_c_3: Scope of Work: The scope of work outlined in the initial agreement cannot be altered without mutual written consent from both parties.
terms_and_conditions.t_c_4: Communication: Both parties agree to maintain open and regular communication throughout the project.
terms_and_conditions.t_c_5: Intellectual Property Rights: All designs, concepts, and materials developed during the project are the intellectual property of the designer, unless otherwise agreed upon in writing.
terms_and_conditions.t_c_6: Confidentiality: Both parties agree to keep all project-related information confidential.
terms_and_conditions.t_c_7: Deliverables: The Developer will provide the client with agreed-upon deliverables according to the project schedule.
terms_and_conditions.t_c_8: Revisions: The agreement includes a specified number of revisions or rounds of changes.
terms_and_conditions.t_c_9: Termination: Either party reserves the right to terminate the agreement in writing if the other party breaches any of its terms.
